member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment
member.summary: Value indicating the alignment of the text in a Paragraph.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment.left
member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text to the left.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment.center
member.summary: Centers the Paragraph's text.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment.right
member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text to the right.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.Alignment.both
member.summary: Align the Paragraph's text to both the left and right margins, adding extra space between the content as necessary.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit
member.summary: Value indicating how a Table should auto resize.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.Contents
member.summary: Fits the columns? widths to their content.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.Window
member.summary: Stretches the Table's width across the page.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.ColumnWidth
member.summary: The Table does not have a fixed width and uses the defined column's width.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.AutoFit.Fixed
member.summary: The Table has a fixed width and uses the defined column's width to calculate its width.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.CapsStyle
member.summary: Value indicating the caps style to apply to the text.

remarks.para: Used with the Paragraph's CapsStyle method (when using the Append or AppendLine methods).
Also used for the CapStyle property of the Formatting class.

member.summary: No caps : every character will be lowercase.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.CapsStyle.caps
member.summary: All caps : every character will be uppercase.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.CapsStyle.smallCaps
member.summary: Small caps : every character will be uppercase, but with a small font size.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType
member.summary: Contains the various positions where DataLabels can be displayed in a Chart.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType.BestFit
member.summary: DataLabels will be displayed in the best position possible.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType.Center
member.summary: DataLabels will be displayed in the middle of the Markers.

summary.para: DataLabels will be displayed at the base of the Markers, inside their surface.
Note that this option only works with Charts where Markers are big enough to have a surface with a clear start (i.e. base) & end, like BarCharts.
DataLabels will be displayed at the end of the Markers, inside their surface.
Note that this option only works with Charts where Markers are big enough to have a surface with a clear start (i.e. base) & end, like BarCharts.
DataLabels will be displayed at the end of the Markers, outside their surface.
Note that this option only works with Charts where Markers are big enough to have a surface with a clear start (i.e. base) & end, like BarCharts.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType.Left
member.summary: DataLabels will be displayed at the left of the Markers.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType.Right
member.summary: DataLabels will be displayed at the right of the Markers.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType.Top
member.summary: DataLabels will be displayed below the Markers.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.DataLabelPositionType.Bottom
member.summary: DataLabels will be displayed below the Markers.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithm
member.summary: Value indicating which hashing algorithm will be used for password protection.

member.summary: No hashing algorithm is applied.

member.summary: Applies the MD2 algorithm.

member.summary: Applies the MD5 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithm.Sha1
member.summary: Applies the SHA-1 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithm.Sha256
member.summary: Applies the SHA-256 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithm.Sha384
member.summary: Applies the SHA-384 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithm.Sha512
member.summary: Applies the SHA-512 algorithm.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithmName
member.summary: Value which defines the names that can be used to refer to specific implementations of hashing algorithms.
member.remarks: These mainly refer to managed variants of common hashing algorithms.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithmName.NotSupported
member.summary: Indicates that the specified algorithm is not supported.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithmName.SHA1
member.summary: Specifies the implementation of the SHA-1 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithmName.SHA1Managed
member.summary: Specifies the managed implementation of the SHA-1 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithmName.SHA256Managed
member.summary: Specifies the managed implementation of the SHA-256 algorithm.

member.summary: Specifies the managed implementation of the SHA-384 algorithm.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithmName.SHA512Managed
member.summary: Specifies the managed implementation of the SHA-512 algorithm.

member.summary: The label is located near the axis.

member.summary: The label is located over the axis values.

member.summary: Value indicating the List's type.

member.summary: A number will be added before each item.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.ListItemType.Bulleted
member.summary: A bullet will be added before each item.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.MarkerStyle
member.summary: Contains the availalbe styles of Markers.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MarkerStyle.None
member.summary: No style will be applied to the Marker.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.MarkerSymbolType
member.summary: List of the possible marker shapes.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.MatchFormattingOptions
member.summary: Value indicating how formatting should be matched.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MatchFormattingOptions.ExactMatch
member.summary: The formatting should be matched exactly. For example, a word in bold and italic will match if the other word is in bold and italic.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MatchFormattingOptions.SubsetMatch
member.summary: The formatting can be matched partially. For example, a word that is in bold can be matched with another word that is in bold and italic because both words are in bold.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode
member.summary: Value indicating the action to take when two documents are merged, and either they both contain a style with the same name but with different attributes, or they both contain headers & footers.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode.Local
member.summary: The style and headers/footers from the local document are kept.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode.Remote
member.summary: The style and headers/footers from the remote document are kept.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.MergingMode.Both
member.summary: The style from the local document is kept. The style of the remote document is given a new name and added to the merged document. The headers/footers from each document are kept when useSectionBreak is true, otherwise the headers/footers from the local document are kept.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.Misc
member.summary: Value indicating the miscellanous property to apply.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.NoteNumberFormat
member.summary: Specifies the possible values for number formatting when using Footnotes & Endnotes.

member.summary: The Watermark will be displayed on even-numbered pages only.

member.summary: The Watermark will be displayed on the first page only.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.SectionScope.AllPages
member.summary: The Watermark will be displayed on all pages.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.SeriesChartType
member.summary: Contains the various types of Series used in a Chart.

remarks.para: Each member corresponds to a type of Chart that can be rendered in Microsoft Word using OpenXML.

summary.para: A classic AreaChart.
Piles up the AreaSeries to show how values stack at specific points on the CategoryAxis.

Piles up the AreaSeries to show their contribution in attaining a value of 100% on the ValueAxis, which means that how values stack at specific points on the CategoryAxis visually represents the percentage each AreaSeries takes in said 100%.
A classic BarChart.
Bars from the various Series are positioned side by side, in groups, so they can easily be compared.
Bars from the various Series are stacked on top of each other.
Bars from the various Series are stacked on top of each other & each bar represents a percentage equal to a fraction of each Series' final 100%.
Columns from the various Series are positioned side by side, in groups, so they can easily be compared.
Columns from the various Series are stacked on top of each other.
Columns from the various Series are stacked on top of each other & each bar represents a percentage equal to a fraction of each Series' final 100%.
LineSeries are drawn using a single line.
LineSeries are drawn using a single line & each data point is identified with a Marker.
LineSeries are drawn using a single line & their values are stacked on top of each other.
LineSeries are drawn using a single line & their values are stacked to represent a percentage equal to their part in attaining the final 100% of each LineSeries.
LineSeries are drawn using a single line & their values are stacked on top of each other; each data point is identified with a Marker.

LineSeries are drawn using a single line & their values are stacked to represent a percentage equal to their part in attaining the final 100% of each LineSeries; each data point is identified with a Marker.
A classic PieChart.
Shows a second pie representing some of the values from the PieChart's main pie.
Shows a bar representing some of the values from the PieChart's main pie.
A classic DoughnutChart.
A classic RadarChart, where the RadarSeries will be drawn using single lines.
The RadarSeries will be drawn using single lines & Markers will identify the Series values.
The RadarSeries will be drawn & their inside will be filled.
Draws the ScatterSeries using points.
Draws the ScatterSeries using points, which also acts as Markers.
Draws the ScatterSeries using lines joining invisible points.
Draws the ScatterSeries using lines joining Markers.
Draws the ScatterSeries using smooth lines joining invisible points.
Draws the ScatterSeries using smooth lines joining Markers.

member.summary: Value indicating the design/style to apply to a Table.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableDesign.Custom
member.summary: The design named in the Table's CustomTableDesignName property will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableDesign.None
member.summary: No design is applied.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches
member.summary: Value indicating the Table of Content Switch to use.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.None
member.summary: No switch is specified.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.A
member.summary: Includes captioned items, but omits caption labels and numbers. The identifier designated by text in the specified value corresponds to the caption label.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.B
member.summary: Includes entries only from the portion of the document identified by the specified bookmark.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.C
member.summary: Includes figures, tables, charts, and other items that are numbered by a SEQ field.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.D
member.summary: When used with \s, the text in the specified value defines the separator between sequence and page numbers. By default, the separator is a hyphen (-).

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.F
member.summary: Includes only those TC fields whose identifier exactly matches the specified value.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.H
member.summary: Makes the table of contents entries hyperlinks.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.L
member.summary: Includes TC fields that assign entries to one of the levels specified by text in the specified value.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.N
member.summary: Page numbers are omitted from all levels unless a range of entry levels is specified by text in the specified value. If no value is specified, omits page numbers from the table of contents.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.O
member.summary: Uses paragraphs formatted with all or the specified range of built-in heading styles.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.P
member.summary: Specifies a sequence of characters that separate an entry and its page number. By default, a tab with leader dots.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.S
member.summary: Adds a prefix to the page number for entries numbered with a SEQ field.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.T
member.summary: Uses paragraphs formatted with styles, indicated in the specified value, other than the built-in heading styles.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.U
member.summary: Uses the applied paragraph outline level.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.W
member.summary: Preserves tab entries within table entries.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.X
member.summary: Preserves newline characters within table entries.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.TableOfContentsSwitches.Z
member.summary: Hides tab leader and page numbers in web layout view.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrappingVerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom.OutSideMargin
member.summary: Element's VerticalOffset is calculated relative to the outside margin.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle
member.summary: Value indicating how the text wraps around an object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapInLineWithText
member.summary: The object acts like a character in a sentence. The line height will be affected by the object's size.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapTopAndBottom
member.summary: There will be no text on the right or left of the object. The text will appear at the top and at the bottom of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapSquare
member.summary: The object is considered a square and the text will appear around that square.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapTight
member.summary: The text will appear around the object and inside a square object but will not enter the defined WrapPolygon.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapThrough
member.summary: The text will appear around the object and inside a square object but will not enter the defined WrapPolygon. Depending on the WrapPolygon size, text could appear inside the middle of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapBehindText
member.summary: The object will be displayed behind the text.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapStyle.WrapInFrontOfText
member.summary: The object will appear in front of the text.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText
member.summary: Value indicating the position of the wrapping text when using the WrapSquare, WrapTight or WrapThrough wrapping styles.
member.remarks: Used when using one of the following WrapStyle: WrapSquare, WrapTight or WrapThrough.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.bothSides
member.summary: Text wraps on both sides of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.left
member.summary: Text wraps on the left side of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.right
member.summary: Text wraps on the right side of the object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Document.NET.WrapText.largest
member.summary: Text wraps around the largest side of the object; if the object is centered, then text wraps around the side on which text is first encountered.

member.name: T:Xceed.Document.NET.Series
member.summary: Represents a series in a Chart.

remarks.para: This class is now abstract & cannot be instantiated directly.
Instead, the appropriate derived class based on the desired type of Chart should be used; for example, use BarSeries for BarCharts, LineSeries for LineCharts or PieSeries for PieCharts.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.DistanceFromTextBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the text & the bottom of the Chart.

remarks.para: The default value is 0.
Note that this property has no effect when the WrapStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText, WrapTight or WrapThrough.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.DistanceFromTextLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the text & the left side of the Chart.

remarks.para: The default value is 0.
Note that this property has no effect when the WrapStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText or WrapTopAndBottom.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.DistanceFromTextRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the text & the right side of the Chart.

remarks.para: The default value is 0.
Note that this property has no effect when the WrapStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText & WrapTopAndBottom.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.DistanceFromTextTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the text & the top of the Chart.

remarks.para: The default value is 0.
Note that this property has no effect when the WrapStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText, WrapTight or WrapThrough.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the Chart's horizontal alignment.

remarks.para: A list of the available alignment options can be found in the WrappingHorizontalAlignement enumeration.
The default value is None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the Chart's horizontal offset.

remarks.para: The default value is 0.
Note that the value of this property is calculated in relation to the value of the HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom property.
Also note that the HorizontalAlignment property must be set to None for this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the point from where the HorizontalOffset will be calculated.

remarks.para: A list of the available options can be found in the WrappingHorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom enumeration.
The default value is None.
Note that the HorizontalAlignement property must be set to None for this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.IsAxisExist
member.summary: Gets if the Chart has an Axis.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.Legend
member.summary: Gets the Chart's Legend.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.MaxSeriesCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of Series available in the Chart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.Series
member.summary: Gets the collection containing all the Chart's Series.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the Chart's vertical alignment.

remarks.para: A list of the available alignment options can be found in the WrappingVerticalAlignement enumeration.
The default value is None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the Chart's vertical offset.

remarks.para: The default value is 0.
Note that the value of this property is calculated in relation to the value of the VerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom property.
Also note that the VerticalAlignment property must be set to None for this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.VerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the point from where the VerticalOffset will be calculated.

remarks.para: A list of the available options can be found in the WrappingVerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom enumeration.
The default value is None.
Note that the VerticalAlignement property must be set to None for this property to take effect.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.WrapPolygon
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of points used to define the polygon where no text can be drawn in the Chart.

remarks.para: The default value is null, but if the WrapStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough, this property's value will automatically default to the 4 corners of the Chart.
Note that a minimum of 3 points is required for this property to work properly.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.WrapStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping style.

remarks.para: A list of the available options can be found in the WrapStyle enumeration.
The default value is WrapInLineWithText.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseChart.WrapTextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping position when the WrapStyle property is set to WrapSquare, WrapTight or WrapThrough.

remarks.para: A list of the available options can be found in the WrapText enumeration.
The default value is BothSides.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseSeries.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the BaseSeries' Color.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseSeries.UsePrimaryAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets if the Series is used as the primary Axis.

remarks.para: When the value is true, the Axis is used as the primary Axis; when the value is false, it is used as the secondary Axis.
Note, however, that some types of Charts cannot have a secondary Axis.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.BaseSeries.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the BaseSeries' width.

member.summary: Replaces all instances of a string with another string, using an handler and the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Container.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleStringReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all of the SearchValues strings with NewValues strings, using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter to do so.
member.remarks: Each SearchValue string will be replaced with its correspondingNewValue string, using the established order to create a correspondence between the strings.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the SearchValues strings with NewValues strings.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Container.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleObjectReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all of the SearchValues strings with NewValuesDocumentElements, using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter to do so.
member.remarks: Each SearchValue string will be replaced with its correspondingNewValueDocumentElement, using the established order to create a correspondence between the strings & the DocumentElements.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the SearchValues strings with NewValuesDocumentElements.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Container.ReplaceTextWithObject(Xceed.Document.NET.ObjectReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all instances of a string with an object using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter.
member.remarks: Currently, the supported objects are Pictures, Tables & Hyperlinks.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the string with an object.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.AddCoreProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a core property to this document. If a core property already exists with the same name, it will be replaced. Core property names are case insensitive.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.AddCustomProperties(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xceed.Document.NET.CustomProperty})
member.summary: Gets the collection of CustomProperty objects & processes them all at once.
member.remarks: Note that even though the AddCustomProperty method can be used, AddCustomProperties performs the costly operations of loading & saving the CustomProperties-related xml file only once instead of creating a new list for each CustomProperty & is thus more efficient.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.AddCustomProperty(Xceed.Document.NET.CustomProperty)
member.summary: Adds a custom property to the Document.

remarks.para: Upon creation of a new property, if one already exists with the same name, the new property will automatically replace the old one.
Note that CustomProperty names are case insensitive.
Also note that even though this method works, it is less efficient than the AddCustomProperties method.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.AddPasswordProtection(Xceed.Document.NET.EditRestrictions,System.String,Xceed.Document.NET.HashAlgorithm)

summary.para: Protects the Document from modifications by adding a protection password.

member.remarks: It is important to make sure that the selected HashAlgorithm is supported in the context of the Document's encryption settings.
member.param:
Defines the type of restrictions that will be applied to the Document.Document
Defines the hashing algorithm that will be used to encrypt the specified password.
If no hashing algorithm is specified, the SHA-512 algorithm will be used by default to encrypt the password.

summary.para: Protects the document from modifications.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.GetPageCount

para.span: Gets the number of pages in the document.

remarks.para: This is an experimental feature which may not always return the exact page count, but gives a good approximation. Results depends on the pages content.
Note that calling this method may slow down your application depending on the number of pages and the content of these pages.

member.returns: Returns the number of pages in the current document.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.UpdateFields
member.summary: Sets a flag to true, so that when the saved document is opened with MS Word, a popup will appear to ask if the fields should be updated.
member.remarks: This method should be called prior to saving the document. If the fields are in a Table of Content (where the headings were modified/added/removed) which needs to be converted to PDF, this method should also be called prior to converting the document to PDF, to keep the Table of Content up to date.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.UpdateTrackChangesAuthor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the name of the user that is currently modifying the Document.
member.remarks: This is useful when changes are tracked; it allows to indicate who modified specific aspects of the Document if more than one person is working on it.
member.param: The name of the user that is currently modifying the Document.The name of the user that will continue with the changes; in other words, the new author.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleStringReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all of the SearchValues strings with NewValues strings, using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter to do so.
member.remarks: Each SearchValue string will be replaced with its correspondingNewValue string, using the established order to create a correspondence between the strings.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the SearchValues strings with NewValues strings.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleObjectReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all of the SearchValues strings with NewValuesDocumentElements, using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter to do so.
member.remarks: Each SearchValue string will be replaced with its correspondingNewValueDocumentElement, using the established order to create a correspondence between the strings & the DocumentElements.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the SearchValues strings with NewValuesDocumentElements.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Document.ReplaceTextWithObject(Xceed.Document.NET.ObjectReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all instances of a string with an object using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter.
member.remarks: Currently, the supported objects are Pictures, Tables & Hyperlinks.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the string with an object.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.InsertBeforeOrAfter.InsertCaptionAfterSelf(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts an incremental caption text under the current picture, table or paragraph.
member.exampleintro: If the captionText is "Figure", the result will be "Figure 1". If this method is used a second time in the document, the result will be "Figure 2", and so on. However, if this method is used with another captionText value, such as "Table", the result will be a new incremental caption series: "Table 1", "Table 2" and so on.
member.returns: The new paragraph with the inserted text.
member.param: The caption text to insert.

member.summary: Gets/sets the numbering format which will be used for a group of automatically numbered ListItems.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ListOptions.TrackChanges
member.summary: Enables or disables the modifications tracking in the list.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Marker.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image that will be used to fill the marker in a designated series or data point. It will overwrite the SolidFill value to null if that value was previously set.
member.remarks: Get will not return the image of a loaded document.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Marker.OutlineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the outline color of a specific marker in a designated series or data point.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Marker.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the marker if SymbolType is set. Note that the value of this property must be positive.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Marker.SolidFill
member.summary: Gets or sets the color that is used to fill the marker in a designated series or data point. It will overwrite the Image value to null if that value was previously set.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Marker.SymbolType
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape of a marker in a series or data point, using the enum MarkerStyle. It can be combined with the Image property to change the final shape.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleObjectReplaceTextOptions.NewValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the DocumentElements that will replace the various SearchValues items.

remarks.para: The default value is null.

Note that the SearchValues property & this property must contain the same number of items since a 1:1 replacement will be done. The item's order will be used to establish a correspondence between the strings & the DocumentElements.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleReplaceTextOptionsBase.EscapeRegEx
member.summary: Gets or sets if the text that will be replaced needs to be escaped.
member.remarks: By default, this is set to true, which means that the text will be escaped using the Regex.Escape(String) method.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleReplaceTextOptionsBase.SearchValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the strings that will be replaced by the new values.
member.remarks: By default, this is set to null.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleReplaceTextOptionsBase.UseRegExSubstitutions
member.summary: Gets or sets if RegEx-like replacement should be performed or, in other words, if the new values contain RegEx substitutions.
member.remarks: By default, this is set to false.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleStringReplaceTextOptions.NewValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the strings that will replace the various SearchValues items.

remarks.para: The default value is null.

Note that the SearchValues property & this property must contain the same number of items since a 1:1 replacement will be done. The item's order will be used to establish a correspondence between the SearchValues & NewValues.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Note.CustomMark
member.summary: Gets/sets the symbol to use for a footnote/endnote instead of the standard number.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.NoteProperties.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets/sets the format to use for the endnote/footnotes numbering values in a section.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.NoteProperties.NumberStart
member.summary: Gets/sets the starting value number for footnote/endnotes in a section.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ObjectReplaceTextOptions.EscapeRegEx
member.summary: Gets or sets if the text that will be replaced needs to be escaped (by using the Regex.Escape(String) method). The default setting is true.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ObjectReplaceTextOptions.NewObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that will replace the text. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ObjectReplaceTextOptions.SearchValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that will be replaced by the NewObject. The default value is null.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.CreateExternalChartXml
member.summary: Creates the default XML structure for the OfPieChart.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.GetChartTypeXElement
member.summary: Returns the root <c:ofPieChart> element from the Chart's XML.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.GetChartTypeXmlName
member.summary: Returns "ofPieChart" as the Chart's type's name.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.AllowedSeriesType
member.summary: Makes sure that Series in an OfPieChart are always PieSeries.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.GapWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the main pie & the bar or second pie.
member.remarks: The value of this property is a percentage & must be between 0 & 500%.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.IsAxisExist
member.summary: Gets if the OfPieChart has an Axis.
member.remarks: This will always return false since an OfPieChart doesn't have an Axis.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.MaxSeriesCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of Series available in the OfPieChart.
member.remarks: This will always return 1, since OfPieCharts only support a single Series.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.OfPieType
member.summary: Gets or sets the OfPieTypeValues, which determines if the OfPieChart will be displayed as a Pie-Of-Pie or a Bar-Of-PieChart.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.SecondPieSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the bar or second pie in relation to the main pie.
member.remarks: The value of this property is a percentage & must be between 5 & 200%.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.OfPieChart.Series
member.summary: Gets the collection containing all the OfPieChart's Series.
member.remarks: Note that only PieSeries are supported.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.PageLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Orientation of this PageLayout.
member.value: The Orientation of the PageLayout.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.PageNumberType.ChapterNumberSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the separator used for a chapter or sub-chapter.

remarks.para: A list of the available options can be found in the ChapterSeparator enumeration.
The default value is Hyphen.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.PageNumberType.ChapterStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text formatting used for the current section chapter in a document. Value must be between 1 and 9 and represents the heading styles. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.PageNumberType.PageNumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the page number. The default value is NumberingFormat.decimalNormal.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.PageNumberType.PageNumberStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting page number for the current section of a document. The default value is null, to indicate that it isn't set automatically. When it isn?t set, the resulting PDF document will continue numbering from the highest page number found in the previous section.

If no UnderlineStyle is currently set, UnderlineStyle.singleLine will be used.

member.returns: This Paragraph with the last appended text's underline color changed.
member.param: The underline Color to apply. If no UnderlineStyle is set, a single line will be used.

member.summary: Applies the provided UnderlineStyle to the last appended text.
member.remarks: This method is used with the Append and AppendLine methods.
member.returns: This Paragraph with the last appended text's underline style changed.
member.param: The UnderlineStyle to apply.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.GetListItemNumber
member.summary: Returns the ListItem number value that this Paragraph represents.

remarks.span: This method only applies if the Paragraph is a ListItem. For example, if the paragraph is a ListItem displayed as "3) Canada", then this method will return "3)".

member.returns: A string representing the ListItem number value.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.InsertComment(Xceed.Document.NET.Comment)
member.summary: Inserts a Comment that will be attached to the whole Paragraph.
member.exception: Note that an InvalidOperationException will be thrown if a Comment with the same ID already exists in the Paragraph.
member.returns: The Comment that has been inserted & attached to the Paragraph.
member.param: The Comment that will be inserted.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.InsertComment(Xceed.Document.NET.Comment,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a Comment that will be applied to a specific text range within the Paragraph
member.exception: Note that an InvalidOperationException will be thrown if if the specified range is invalid or if the Comment ID already exists in the Paragraph.
member.remarks: Note that an InvalidDataException can also be thrown if the specified range cannot be found in the Paragraph.
member.returns: The Comment that has been inserted into the Paragraph.
member.param: The Comment that will be inserted into the Paragraph.CommentComment

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.InsertComment(Xceed.Document.NET.Comment,System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a Comment that will be attached to the first occurence of a specific word in the Paragraph.
member.exception: Note that an ArgumentException will be thrown if the specified word is not found in the Paragraph.
member.returns: The Comment that has been inserted into the Paragraph.
member.param: The Comment that will be inserted into the Paragraph.Comment

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.StringReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all instances of a string with another string using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the string with another string.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleStringReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all of the SearchValues strings with NewValues strings, using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter to do so.
member.remarks: Each SearchValue string will be replaced with its correspondingNewValue string, using the established order to create a correspondence between the strings.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the SearchValues strings with NewValues strings.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.MultipleObjectReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all of the SearchValues strings with NewValuesDocumentElements, using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter to do so.
member.remarks: Each SearchValue string will be replaced with its correspondingNewValueDocumentElement, using the established order to create a correspondence between the strings & the DocumentElements.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the SearchValues strings with NewValuesDocumentElements.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.ReplaceText(Xceed.Document.NET.FunctionReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all instances of a string with another string using an handler and the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the string with an handler.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.ReplaceTextWithObject(Xceed.Document.NET.ObjectReplaceTextOptions)
member.summary: Replaces all instances of a string with an object using the options set via the replaceTextOptions parameter.
member.remarks: Currently, the supported objects are Pictures, Tables & Hyperlinks.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one text replacement is done.
member.param: The options that will be used when replacing the string with an object.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.SetLineSpacing(Xceed.Document.NET.LineSpacingType,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the line spacing for this Paragraph (in points), manually.

remarks.para: This method expects a value expressed in points (pt).

list.item: To convert to 20th of a point (dxa) : pt*20

member.param: The LineSpacingType to use.The spacing value to use (in points).

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Paragraph.SetLineSpacing(Xceed.Document.NET.LineSpacingTypeAuto)
member.summary: Sets the line spacing for this Paragraph (in points), automatically.

remarks.para: Using LineSpacingTypeAuto.Auto will set both the Before and After values.
Using LineSpacingTypeAuto.None will remove any line spacing.
The automatic Line spacing is 25 points.

list.item: To convert to 20th of a point (dxa) : pt*20

member.param: The LineSpacingTypeAuto to use.

member.value: The transparency of the Picture.

remarks.span: Valid values are from 0 (no transparency) to 1 (completely transparent).

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Picture.Cropping
member.summary: Gets or sets the portion of the unscaled original image to draw (from 0 to 100 on the 4 sides).
member.value: A SideValues value indicating the portion of the unscaled original image to draw.

remarks.para: Each edge of the image is defined by a percentage offset from the edge of the bounding box.

For example, a left offset of 25% specifies that the left edge of the image is located to the right of the bounding box's left edge by 25% of the bounding box's width. Example of a value for the left edge: 25.000.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Picture.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the Description of this Picture.
member.value: The Description of the Picture.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Picture.DistanceFromTextBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance of the text from the bottom of the Picture (in points).
member.value: The distance of the text from the bottom of the Picture (in points). By default, 0.

remarks.para: This property has no effect when the Picture's WrapStyle property is set to WrapInLineWithText, WrapBehindText, WrapInFrontOfText, WrapTight and WrapThrough.
The value in this property is expressed in points (pt).

list.item: To convert to 20th of a point (dxa) : pt*20

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Picture.WrapPolygon
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of points to use to define the polygon inside the Picture where no text can be drawn.
member.value: The list of points to use to define the polygon inside the Picture where no text can be drawn. A minimum of 3 points are necessary in order to activate the WrapPolygon. By default, null (unless the Picture's WrapStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough, in which case it will contain the 4 corners of the Picture by default, meaning no text inside the Picture).

remarks.para: This property is used when the Picture's WrapStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough.
The top left of a Picture has the coordinates (0,0), while the bottom right has the coordinates (21600,21600).

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Picture.WrapStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping style. The default setting is WrapInLineWithText.
member.remarks: The default setting is WrapInLineWithText.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.Picture.WrapTextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping position.
member.remarks: The default value is bothSides.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.ContainerLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Container(s) that will be parsed when replacing text in a Document. The default value is All.
member.remarks: Note that any combination of Containers is valid.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.EndIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index that pinpoints the location where the text search will end. The default value is -1.

remarks.para: To activate the search, a value greater than 0 is required. However, when the value for StartIndex is also greater than 0, the EndIndex value needs to be greater than the value set in StartIndex for the search to work.
Note that the search can only work in the body of a Document.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.FormattingToMatch
member.summary: Gets or sets the formatting that the existing text must have in order to be replaced. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The options for this property are found in the FormattingToMatchOptions property.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.FormattingToMatchOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets how the existing formatting needs to be matched in order for the text replacement to occur. The default setting is SubsetMatch.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.RegExOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for the regular expression. The default setting is None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.RemoveEmptyParagraph
member.summary: Gets or sets if empty Paragraphs should be removed once the text replacement is done. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.StartIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index that pinpoints the location where the text search will start. The default value is -1.

remarks.para: To activate the search, a value greater than 0 is required. However, when the value for EndIndex is also greater than 0, the StartIndex value needs to be smaller than the value set in EndIndex for the search to work.
Note that the search can only work in the body of a Document.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.StopAfterOneReplacement
member.summary: Gets or sets if the text search will be stopped once the first text replacement is completed. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Note that text replacement will only work in the body of a Document.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.ReplaceTextOptionsBase.TrackChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets if the changes, in this case the text replacement, will be tracked. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment for the SignatureLine. By default, None.
The SignatureLine can be positioned Left, Centered, Right, Inside or Outside, relative to Margin, Page, Column, Character, LeftMargin, RightMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.HorizontalOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal offset (in points) of the SignatureLine in relation to the element identified in the HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom property. By default, 0.
The HorizontalAlignment property must be set to None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.HorizontalOffsetAlignmentFrom
member.summary:
Gets or sets the element from which the HorizontalOffset is calculated. By default, None.
The HorizontalAlignment property must be set to None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.Id
member.summary:
Gets the Id of the SignatureLine.
When creating a SignatureLine, an Id will automatically be generated; use this id in the SignOptions to associate a SignatureLine with a Digital Signature.

summary.para:
Gets or sets the instructions relative to this SignatureLine.
Used to inform the signer of the reason to sign this SignatureLine.

member.summary: Gets if the SignatureLine is currently signed.

member.summary: Gets if the SignatureLine is currently signed and has a valid digital signature.

member.summary: Gets or sets if the signing date should be displayed on the top right corner of the SignatureLine. Default is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested signer of the SignatureLine.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.SignerEmail
member.summary: Gets or sets the e-mail address of the suggested signer of the SignatureLine.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.SignerTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the suggested signer of the SignatureLine.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.VerticalAlignment
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical alignment for the SignatureLine. By default, None.
The SignatureLine can be positioned at Top, Centered, Bottom, Inside or Outside, relative to Margin, Page, Line, TopMargin, BottomMargin, InsideMargin or OutsideMargin.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.VerticalOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical offset (in points) of the SignatureLine in relation to the element identified in the VerticalOffsetAlignmentFrom property. By default, 0.
The VerticalAlignment property must be set to None.

summary.para:
Gets or sets the element from which the VerticalOffset is calculated. By default, None.
The VerticalAlignment property must be set to None.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.WrapPolygon
member.summary:
Gets or sets the list of points used to define the polygon inside the SignatureLine where no text can be drawn.
A minimum of 3 points are necessary in order to activate the WrapPolygon. By default, null (unless the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough, in which case it will contain the 4 corners of the picture by default, meaning no text inside the SignatureLine).
This property is used when the SignatureLine's WrappingStyle property is set to WrapTight or WrapThrough.
The top left of a SignatureLine has the coordinates (0,0), while the bottom right has the coordinates (21600,21600).

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.WrapStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping style. The default setting is WrapInLineWithText.

member.name: P:Xceed.Document.NET.SignatureLine.WrapTextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the text wrapping position. The default setting is bothSides.
member.remarks: Used when selecting one of the following PictureWrapStyle: WrapSquare, WrapTight or WrapThrough. Text can be positionned on both sides of the SignatureLine, on the left of the SignatureLine, on the right of the SignatureLine or on the largest side of the SignatureLine.

summary.para: Gets or sets if the comments accompanying the SignatureLine will be displayed. Default is true.

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Table.SetWidths(System.Single[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the widths of this Table's columns (in points).

exampleintro.para: The following examples assume that the page size is 450 pts.

1) table.SetWidths( new float[] { 100f, 100, 200f } );
The resulting columns' sizes will be 100, 100 and 200, because the total width of the array (400) is smaller than the page size (450).

remarks.para: This method expects values expressed in points (pt).

list.item: To convert to 20th of a point (dxa) : pt*20

remarks.para: When the Table.AutoFit property is set to "Fixed", the columns' widths from the array parameter will be applied as is.

When the Table.AutoFit property is not set to "Fixed", the columns' widths from the array parameter will be applied as is, except if the total width received exceeds the page's available space. In this situation, a ratio is calculated to adjust the columns' widths from the array parameter to fit on the page.

member.param: The array of widths to set (one entry per column, in points).truefalse

member.name: M:Xceed.Document.NET.Table.SetWidthsPercentage(System.Single[],System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Sets the widths of this Table's columns, using the provided total width (in points) and a width percentage for each column.

remarks.para: This method expects a totalWidth value expressed in points (pt).

list.item: To convert to 20th of a point (dxa) : pt*20

member.param: The array of width percentages to use (in points).The total width of the columns. If null, the maximum width available is used.
